solutions.title: Solutions
solutions.description: Carbon Credits, GHG Protocol and ESG for companies leading the transition to a low-carbon economy.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Environmental projects with traceability, real-time monitoring and full transparency in the generation of carbon credits.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: UN Global Compact, SDGs and ICMA principles integrated into financial strategy, governance and socio-environmental impact.

about.headline: We are a multinational company with operations in Brazil and Argentina, working in the low-carbon economy to connect sustainable projects, environmental preservation and financial operations. Our commitment is to generate positive impact for the next generations through transparent, secure and innovative solutions that drive a greener and more resilient future.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: To offer low-carbon economy projects that generate wealth in a sustainable way, through transparent, secure financial solutions capable of connecting companies and investors to real impact opportunities.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To achieve global excellence in the financial market by 2030, delivering innovative and sustainable solutions that consolidate Stock Green Asset as a reference in green finance and ESG governance.

values.title: Values
values.text: Ethics, Loyalty, Transparency, Excellence, Security and Innovation guide our governance and all the long-term relationships we build.

carbon.item1: Generation and trading of certified carbon credits
carbon.item2: Projects developed under Verra VCS and CCB standards
carbon.item3: Validated projects with traceability in line with national and international standards
carbon.item4: Projects audited and verified by independent third parties
carbon.item5: Tailor-made offsetting solutions, adapted to client needs

ghg.item2: Technical implementation of the GHG Protocol with high accuracy
ghg.item4: Reports aligned with regulatory and voluntary requirements

esg.item2: Development of ESG policies and indicators
esg.item3: Integration of ESG practices into the business model
esg.item4: Support for decision-making focused on risks and opportunities

card.title: About the Project
card.paragraph1: The Stock Carbon Mazuay REDD+ Project aims to reduce carbon emissions from deforestation and forest degradation, promoting conservation and sustainable forest management in critical preservation areas.
card.paragraph2: The initiative contributes to global greenhouse gas (GHG) reduction targets, generates environmental and social benefits for local communities and preserves the biodiversity of threatened ecosystems.

intro.p1: We have publicly committed to sustainability by adhering to the UN Global Compact, incorporating advanced social and environmental responsibility practices aligned with the SDGs.
intro.p2: This commitment guides our decisions and reflects our determination to build real and lasting impact for society and the environment.

humanRights.title: Human Rights
items: Principle 1: Businesses should support and respect the protection of internationally proclaimed human rights;
Principle 2: Make sure that they are not complicit in human rights abuses.

labour.title: Labour
items: Principle 3: Businesses should uphold the freedom of association and the effective recognition of the right to collective bargaining;
Principle 4: The elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour;
Principle 5: The effective abolition of child labour; and
Principle 6: The elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation.

environment.title: Environment
items: Principle 7: Businesses should support a precautionary approach to environmental challenges;
Principle 8: Undertake initiatives to promote greater environmental responsibility; and
Principle 9: Encourage the development and diffusion of environmentally friendly technologies.

anticorruption.title: Anti-Corruption
items: Principle 10: Businesses should work against corruption in all its forms, including extortion and bribery.

ods.heading: The Sustainable Development Goals
ods.description: We reaffirm our commitment to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), connecting our sustainable investment initiatives with global targets for a more inclusive, equitable and climate-resilient future.

5.title: Gender Equality
5.description: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls.

6.title: Clean Water and Sanitation
6.description: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all.

8.title: Decent Work and Economic Growth
8.description: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all.

13.title: Climate Action
13.description: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts.

17.title: Partnerships for the Goals
17.description: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalise the global partnership for sustainable development.

icma.heading: Commitments to Stakeholders
icma.p1: As signatories of the International Capital Market Association (ICMA), we are committed to adhering to global best practices in governance, transparency and responsibility in capital markets.
icma.p2: We align with ICMA guidelines for issuing financial instruments that integrate value creation with environmental, social and governance (ESG) criteria, reinforcing our commitment to an innovative and sustainable financial market.
icma.p3: Our framework is based on essential principles, including:

guideline1.title: 1. Green, Social and Sustainability Bond Guidelines (2021)
guideline1.text: – Regulated by ICMA, they establish best practices for the issuance of instruments in capital markets.

guideline2.title: 2. Green and Social Loan Principles (2021)
guideline2.text: – Published by the Loan Market Association (LMA), they define standards for bilateral and syndicated loans with financial institutions and multilateral agencies.

icma.p4: These principles structure our framework, ensuring compliance with the highest international standards of sustainability and social responsibility. They promote transparency, integrity in fundraising and alignment with the expectations of investors and society.
icma.p5: We developed this framework with a focus on clear and transparent communication with our stakeholders, ensuring that all stages of our projects and resource management are carried out responsibly.

useOfProceeds.title: 1. Use of proceeds
useOfProceeds.p1: Proceeds raised through sustainable instruments are allocated to eligible projects that generate positive environmental and social impact, including:
useOfProceeds.li1: Development of forest projects (REDD+) and carbon removal projects, as well as the recovery of degraded areas;
useOfProceeds.li2: Preservation and restoration of natural landscapes;
useOfProceeds.li4: Educational support and vocational training programmes for young people in vulnerable communities.

projectSelection.title: 2. Project evaluation and selection process
projectSelection.p1: The project selection process follows technical, social, environmental and governance criteria, including:
projectSelection.li2: Analysis of technical and environmental feasibility;
projectSelection.li4: Assessment of social and environmental impact.

management.title: 3. Management of proceeds
management.p1: Proceeds raised through the issued Sustainable Bonds will be managed by Stock Green Asset in line with best governance practices and our Sustainability Framework.
management.p2: Proceeds will be allocated to portfolios of eligible green or social assets and projects, selected according to the eligibility criteria defined in the Use of Proceeds principle.
management.p3: We maintain dedicated controls, with independent reporting to the Executive Committee, to determine and oversee the portfolio of eligible projects and the amount of proceeds allocated to the Sustainable Bonds.
management.p4: In any situation where part of the proceeds has not yet been allocated, Stock Green Asset undertakes to:
management.ol1: Keep the unallocated balance in cash or in highly liquid, low-risk government securities; and
management.ol2: Reallocate proceeds as soon as possible to eligible projects, in line with the established eligibility criteria.

reporting.title: 4. Reporting
reporting.p1: As part of our transparency practices and commitment to governance best practices, we intend to publish an annual consolidated report on our website containing:
reporting.li1: Information on proceeds raised through Sustainable Bonds;
reporting.li2: Details of eligible projects financed with these proceeds;
reporting.li3: Social and environmental impact indicators associated with the investments.
reporting.p2: The reports may include, among other items:
reporting.ol1: Amounts allocated to eligible project categories;
reporting.ol2: Percentage of net proceeds allocated to eligible investments; and
reporting.ol3: Proportion of eligible investments used for refinancing versus new investments.
reporting.p3: These reports will be subject to independent review by an external verifier or consultant, reinforcing the integrity and accuracy of the information disclosed.

heading.line1: We believe that the low-carbon economy
heading.line2: can be transparent, accessible and sustainable.

body.p1: Our governance philosophy is based on the conviction that the connection between capital and sustainable projects must happen with clear rules, reliable information and robust processes. That is why we structure our decision-making flows, compliance and risk management to ensure that every transaction reflects transparency, security and alignment with the low-carbon economy.
body.p2: Operating in Brazil and Argentina, we follow global best practices in the financial market and ESG principles, aligned with ethics, loyalty, transparency, excellence and innovation. Our governance integrates the work of the board, executive management and independent monitoring structures, ensuring accountability at every stage of the value chain.
body.p3: By making the low-carbon economy more accessible and sustainable, we provide investors with clear reports, dedicated communication channels, and a continued commitment to integrity. The RI Portal is one of the pillars of this journey, bringing together strategic information to support reliable, long-term decision-making.

socialProjects.title: Framework for Social Projects
socialProjects.intro: Stock Green Asset is structuring an educational social impact program focused on technical training for young people in communities with low human development levels, connecting quality education, sustainable development and long-term capital.

projectType.title: Type of Project
projectType.text: Stock Green Asset’s social project focuses on creating a technical educational school based on practical training and aligned with the demands of a world in transition to a low-carbon economy.

targetAudience.title: Target Audience
targetAudience.text: Teenagers between 15 and 20 years old, enrolled in high school and living in communities and municipalities with below-average HDI. The proposal is to open access to quality technical education and create new career perspectives.

scale.title: Scale and Goal
scale.text1: The program aims to train 1,000 young people by 2030, distributed between Brazil and Argentina, with progressive classes and structured expansion over the years.
scale.text2: Implementation begins with pilot cohorts and scales gradually, always prioritising academic quality, proper infrastructure and close student support.

locations.title: Implementation Locations
locations.text1: The first unit will be located in the Province of Salta, Argentina, with planned expansion to regions in Brazil where Stock Green Asset carries out environmental preservation projects.
locations.text2: In this way, social projects follow environmental projects, generating integrated impact: climate, territory and human development.

investment.title: Investment & Financing
investment.text1: Stock Green Asset aims to allocate US$ 1,000,000.00 to social projects, distributed equally between Brazil and Argentina.
investment.text2: Resources are raised through Sustainable Bonds and, after the initial implementation period, the project will be subsidised by revenue from the sale of carbon credits, aligning education, sustainable finance and the carbon market in a single strategy.

ods.title: Objectives & SDGs
ods.description: The project integrates the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) into its educational methodology, preparing a generation that is aware, engaged and technically skilled.

listLeft.item1: Raise awareness about global challenges and the SDGs.
listLeft.item2: Encourage engagement in real, hands-on projects.
listLeft.item3: Develop critical thinking and technical skills.
listLeft.item4: Empower young people as agents of transformation.

listRight.item1: Integrate core subjects and technology content.
listRight.item3: Bridge education, labour market and innovation.

methodology.title: Educational Methodology
methodology.text1: The school adopts Project-Based Learning (PBL), connecting real challenges from local communities, the UN SDGs and technical training tracks.
methodology.text2: Students develop projects that integrate language, mathematics, science and technology — such as programming, robotics and digital design — always focused on solutions applicable to the territories where they live.

monitoring.title: Monitoring, Metrics & Quality
monitoring.description: Stock Green Asset adopts a monitoring model that evaluates both individual student performance and the overall quality of the educational institution.

studentLevel.title: Student Level
studentLevel.item1: Continuous monitoring of grades and participation.
studentLevel.item2: Definition of a minimum passing score.

institutionLevel.title: Institutional Level
institutionLevel.item2: Overall pass rate as a performance indicator.
institutionLevel.item3: Qualitative feedback from students and teachers.

governance.title: Governance & Faculty
governance.text1: Stock Green Asset’s corporate governance is responsible for structuring, selecting and monitoring eligible social projects, ensuring alignment with the Sustainable Bonds Framework and local regulations.
governance.text2: Faculty selection follows minimum criteria for academic education, proven experience and alignment with the project’s educational purpose, ensuring quality and consistency in the delivery of teaching.

contact.title: Stock Green Asset
contact.subtitle: Transforming capital markets through sustainable and innovative solutions.

message.label: Message
message.placeholder: Briefly tell us how we can support your company.

form.success: Your message has been sent successfully! We will get back to you shortly.
form.error: Unable to send your message. Please try again later.
form.disclaimer: By sending this form, you agree to be contacted by Stock Green Asset for institutional purposes.

header.lead: The Stock Carbon – Mazuay REDD+ project is located in Silves, in the state of Amazonas, Brazil, and aims to avoid emissions from deforestation and forest degradation, preserving an area of native forest of high environmental and climate relevance.

about.p1: The Stock Carbon Mazuay REDD+ Project aims to reduce carbon emissions from deforestation and forest degradation, promoting conservation and sustainable forest management in critical preservation areas.
about.p2: The initiative contributes to global greenhouse gas (GHG) reduction targets, generates environmental and social benefits for local communities and preserves the biodiversity of threatened ecosystems.

description.heading: Description
description.p1: The Stock Carbon Mazuay REDD+ Project is an environmental and forest preservation initiative implemented in Gleba Mazuay, a rural property located in the municipality of Silves, in the state of Amazonas (AM), Brazil.
description.p2: The total area of the property is 989.3423 hectares, of which 966.4202 hectares correspond to Remaining Native Vegetation, representing more than 97% of the property’s total area.
description.p3: The property stands out for its ecologically significant characteristics, particularly its vast native vegetation cover, which contributes to the maintenance of biodiversity and ecosystem services.
description.p5: The forest inventory carried out in the area identified 18,697 trees, distributed across 76 different species, demonstrating the high biodiversity and richness of the Amazon ecosystem present in Gleba Mazuay.
description.p6: The Stock Carbon Mazuay REDD+ Project seeks to preserve and manage Gleba Mazuay in a sustainable way, aligning efforts to mitigate climate change through the conservation of tropical forests.
description.p7: Over a 20-year period, the project aims to generate 718,455.73 carbon credits, contributing significantly to the capture and storage of greenhouse gases and reinforcing the role of the Amazon as one of the world’s major climate regulators.

location.heading: Location & Context
location.p2: The region is characterised by high biodiversity and great relevance for the maintenance of ecosystem services such as climate regulation, protection of water resources and conservation of natural habitats.

structure.heading: Environmental Structure
structure.p1:
• Native vegetation area: 966.42 ha (97% of the total area).
• Permanent Preservation Area (APP): 134.61 ha.
• Legal Reserve: 854.28 ha.
structure.p2: The project is structured to preserve the integrity of the native forest, ensuring compliance with Brazilian environmental legislation and the sustainable use of the territory.

biodiversity.heading: Biodiversity & Forest Inventory
biodiversity.intro: The project includes a detailed vegetation inventory, which covers:

list.monitoring: • Continuous monitoring of forest structure to ensure habitat conservation and the maintenance of biological diversity.

biodiversity.closing: These data are essential to prove the ecological integrity of the area and support the calculation of carbon stored in biomass.

carbonPotential.heading: Carbon Credit Potential
carbonPotential.p1: By avoiding deforestation in a highly threatened native forest area, the Stock Carbon – Mazuay REDD+ project has an estimated potential for carbon credit generation over time.
carbonPotential.p2: Each credit represents one ton of CO₂ equivalent that is not emitted into the atmosphere, contributing directly to global climate targets and emission reduction commitments.

monitoringGovernance.heading: Monitoring, Technology & Governance
monitoringGovernance.intro: The project adopts a robust governance model based on transparency, traceability and continuous monitoring.

items.realtime: • Real-time monitoring through satellite imagery and geospatial data.
items.traceability: • Registration and traceability of credits using blockchain technologies, ensuring transparency and data integrity.
items.audits: • Independent audits to verify climate, social and environmental performance.

monitoringGovernance.closing: This set of mechanisms strengthens the confidence of investors, regulators and partners, ensuring that each credit reflects real and measurable impact.

impacts.heading: Climate, Social & Environmental Impacts
impacts.intro: The Stock Carbon – Mazuay REDD+ project was designed to generate positive impact in multiple dimensions:

blockchain.heading: Blockchain Governance
blockchain.p1: We have developed a Transparency Portal based on blockchain to ensure maximum trust and security for our stakeholders in greenhouse gas (GHG) offsetting initiatives and carbon credit acquisition.
blockchain.p2: The platform offers the following features:

items.tracking: • Immutable tracking: each carbon credit can be tracked from its origin to final offsetting.
items.duplication: • Double-counting prevention: cryptographic system that prevents credits from being used more than once.
items.authenticity: • Guaranteed authenticity: monitoring data, audits and validations are recorded transparently and can be verified.
items.governance: • Advanced governance: auditable reports aligned with ESG best practices, strengthening investor and regulator confidence.
items.engagement: • Transparent engagement: blockchain data allow investors, consumers and other stakeholders to follow GHG offsetting actions and climate initiatives in real time.

report.heading: Monitoring Report
report.p1: Stock Green Asset will present a detailed monitoring report aimed at highlighting the climate, social and environmental impacts of its projects certified under the VCS REDD+ and CCB Verra standards.
report.p2: The report will include, among other points:

items.climate: • Climate Results: avoided or removed emissions, quantitative data on carbon capture and storage, and methodologies used for calculation.
items.environment: • Environmental Impacts: information on biodiversity conservation, restoration of degraded ecosystems and assessment of environmental quality.
items.social: • Social Benefits: indicators of income generation, training of local communities and improvements in living conditions.
items.compliance: • Compliance: results of external audits, certifications and validations by independent parties, ensuring transparency and integrity of the results.

sdgs.heading: The Sustainable Development Goals
sdgs.description: In the Carbon Mazuay REDD+ project, we adopt the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and sustainability practices aligned with ESG principles, actively contributing to a more sustainable and inclusive future.

satellite.heading: Satellite Imagery Monitoring
satellite.description: Track the evolution of the project’s forest cover across different periods.

realtime.heading: Real-time Monitoring
realtime.p1: Stock Green Asset recognizes the strategic importance of real-time monitoring to ensure the effectiveness of environmental and forest preservation actions. Using advanced technologies, we perform analyses that detect and prevent illegal deforestation, control unauthorized forest management, identify early fire outbreaks, and monitor critical environmental indicators.
realtime.p2: Information is collected from satellites such as Sentinel-1 (synthetic aperture radar) and Sentinel-2 (multispectral optical sensors), providing data on land use, vegetation, water quality, and other indicators, enhancing transparency and enabling faster decision-making.

body.p1: Stock Green Asset connects companies, financial institutions, impact organizations and technology providers to form an ecosystem that accelerates the transition to a low-carbon economy.
body.p2: Our partners scale projects, strengthen ESG governance and help transform capital into measurable climate, social and environmental impact.

partnersPage.intro: Our ecosystem brings together companies, financial institutions, impact organizations and technology providers that, together with Stock Green Asset, drive sustainable finance, carbon markets and ESG governance projects.
